objects.name: Scythe - Conti2
objects.description: Imported from Scythe.

redTeam.objective: Emulate adversary technique of Data Encrypted for Impact by using Scythe to execute crypt module with params `--target %USERPROFILE%\Desktop\egregor\x_target_files\ --password h3ll0w0rld --encrypt --erase`.
Emulate adversary technique of System Information Discovery by using Scythe to execute run module with params `systeminfo`.
Emulate adversary technique of Data Staged by using Scythe to execute run module with params `powershell mkdir "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\DarkSide"`.
Emulate adversary technique of Domain Accounts by using Scythe to execute run module with params `echo %userdomain%`.
Emulate adversary technique of Command and Scripting Interpreter by using Scythe to execute run module with params `cmd /c del %userprofile%\Documents\exfil.dat"`.

Emulate adversary technique of Archive Collected Data by using Scythe to execute run module with params `powershell "Compress-Archive %USERPROFILE%\Desktop\berserk %USERPROFILE%\Desktop\berserk.zip"`.
Emulate adversary technique of Exfiltration Over C2 Channel by using Scythe to execute uploader module with params `--remotepath %userprofile%\Documents\exfil.dat`.
Emulate adversary technique of System Network Configuration Discovery by using Scythe to execute run module with params `ipconfig /all`.
Emulate adversary technique of System Owner/User Discovery by using Scythe to execute run module with params `whoami`.

Emulate adversary technique of Remote Access Software by using Scythe to execute downloader module with params `--src VFS:/shared/APT41/PowerView.ps1 --dest %USERPROFILE%\Desktop\APT41\PowerView.ps1 `.
Emulate adversary technique of Remote Access Software by using Scythe to execute controller module with params `--shutdown`.
Emulate adversary technique of Command and Scripting Interpreter by using Scythe to execute run module with params `net use`.
Emulate adversary technique of Data Staged by using Scythe to execute file module with params `--create --path %userprofile%\Documents\exfil.dat --size 104857600 --random `.
Emulate adversary technique of Command and Scripting Interpreter by using Scythe to execute run module with params `cmd /c rmdir /Q /S %USERPROFILE%\Desktop\Conti"`.
Emulate adversary technique of Command and Scripting Interpreter by using Scythe to execute run module with params `powershell notepad "%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\README.txt"`.

redTeam.variant: Scythe - Run command net config workstation
redTeam.objective: Emulate adversary technique of System Network Connections Discovery by using Scythe to execute run module with params `net config workstation`.

objects.name: Scythe
objects.description: Imported from Scythe.

objects.name: Default
objects.description: Combination of commonly used traditional kill chain phases in addition to all MITRE Tactics. (17 total phases or tactics to map test cases to)

objects.name: MITRE Enterprise Tactics
objects.description: Standard alignment to MITRE Enterprise Tactics. (All 12 Tactics available for to map test cases to)

objects.name: Unified Kill Chain
objects.description: Includes full unified kill chain with traditional kill chain phases in addition to all MITRE tactics. Â The unified kill chain is similar to the "default" profile above but also enables "Weaponization", "Resource Development", "Target Manipulation", "Pivoting", and "Social Engineering". (Includes 21 total phases/tactics to map test cases to)

objects.name: Credential Access
objects.description: Techniques resulting in the access of, or control over, system, service or domain credentials

objects.name: Action on Objectives
objects.description: Steps involving final acquisition of the adversary's objectives, including extraction of sensitive data and compromise of sensitive business applications, or initiation of sensitive financial transactions

objects.name: Exploitation
objects.description: Techniques to exploit vulnerabilities in systems that may, amongst others, result in code execution

objects.name: Collection
objects.description: Techniques used to identify and gather information from a target network prior to exfiltration

objects.name: Weaponization
objects.description: Coupling a remote access trojan with an exploit into a deliverable payload

objects.name: Persistence
objects.description: Any access, action or change to a system that gives an attacker persistent presence on the system

objects.name: Privilege Escalation
objects.description: The result of techniques that provide an attacker with higher permissions on a system or network

objects.name: Resource Development
objects.description:
The adversary is trying to establish resources they can use to support operations.

Resource Development consists of techniques that involve adversaries creating, purchasing, or compromising/stealing resources that can be used to support targeting. Such resources include infrastructure, accounts, or capabilities. These resources can be leveraged by the adversary to aid in other phases of the adversary lifecycle, such as using purchased domains to support Command and Control, email accounts for phishing as a part of Initial Access, or stealing code signing certificates to help with Defense Evasion.

objects.name: Discovery
objects.description: Techniques that allow an attacker to gain knowledge about a system and its internal network

objects.name: Impact
objects.description: Covers integrity and availability attacks against enterprise systems. Each technique will include an Impact Type label of 'Integrity' or 'Availability'.

objects.name: Command & Control
objects.description: Techniques that allow attackers to communicate with controlled systems within a target network

objects.name: Initial Access
objects.description: Techniques used for initial target compromise

objects.name: Execution
objects.description: Techniques that result in execution of attacker-controlled code on a local or remote system

objects.name: Target Manipulation
objects.description: Techniques aimed at manipulation of the target system to achieve the objective of the attack

objects.name: Lateral Movement
objects.description: Techniques that enable an adversary to access and control remote systems on a network

objects.name: Reconnaissance
objects.description: Researching, identifying and selecting targets using active or passive reconnaissance

objects.name: Delivery
objects.description: Techniques resulting in the transmission of the payload to the targeted environment

objects.name: Exfiltration
objects.description: Techniques that result or aid in an attacker removing files and information from a target network

objects.name: Defense Evasion
objects.description: Techniques an attacker may use for the purpose of evading detection or avoiding other defenses

objects.name: Pivoting
objects.description: Tunnelling traffic through a controlled system to other systems that are not directly accessible

objects.name: Social Engineering
objects.description: Techniques involving human interaction with targets, ranging from spear phishing, phone calls, information gathering and reconnaissance on personnel and physical security, and other possible techniques

objects.name: Scythe
objects.description: Imported from Scythe.
